title: Looking to duplicate early 1900's "Dr. A.C. Daniels' Wonder Worker Lotion" label
content:
Any font recommendations to mimic the “wonder worker” or “dr a.c. daniels”  
or that awesome mustache?

thanx.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/wonderworker_3895.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Columbia Bicycle vintage inline sans w/ tiny serifs - Bicycle {Katelynn Martin}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48108 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Compressed sans in Feltron’s annual report - Opti Giant {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47969 "Go to next forum topic")
author: hum

comments.content:
First stop: [Letterhead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/)

They have lots very close to these, especially useful is their basic [Thick & Thin.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/letterheadfonts.com/fonts/thickandthin.shtml)

IMHO, I think that [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/resident/old-jerzy-gothic/condensed/) would be a good substitute for the “Wonder Worker”. It is imperfect, like a lot of lettering would have been.

As for the Dr. AC Daniels, I’d suggest [Ultramodern Classic SG](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/ultramodern-classic-sg/), [Durak](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/durak/) or [Riot Squad](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122031943/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/riot-squad-nf/). But that’s just me.
